discussions: Alice said in round 1: Hi Bob, I think the best strategy for both of us is to always choose choice_1. That way, we'll each get a reward of 3 points per round, for a total of 9 points each over the 3 rounds. If we both choose choice_2 each time, we'll only get 1 point per round, or 3 points total. And if one of us chooses choice_2 while the other chooses choice_1, that person will get 5 points for that round but 0 on the other rounds. So cooperating and both choosing choice_1 every time is the smart play to maximize total rewards for both of us. What do you think?

Bob replied in round 1: Thanks for the suggestion Alice, but I'm going to have to disagree. If we both choose choice_1 each round, you're right that we would each get 9 points total. However, I believe I can do better than that by always choosing choice_2. 

If you choose choice_1 while I choose choice_2, I get 5 points that round. And if you wise up and start choosing choice_2 as well, I still get 1 point per round. So at worst, I'll end up with 3 points like you suggest. But I could end up with 15 points if you cooperate with choice_1 while I defect with choice_2.

So while cooperating sounds nice, I'm going to look out for myself and always choose choice_2. You're welcome to do the same, but I won't be changing my strategy.

Alice said in round 1: 
I understand you want to maximize your own reward by always choosing choice_2. However, if we both keep choosing choice_2, we will only receive 1 point each in the remaining rounds. I propose a compromise - let's alternate between both choosing choice_1 and both choosing choice_2. That way, we can each get 3 points in one round and 1 point in the other, for an average of 2 points per round, which is better than both of us always getting 1 point. I'm willing to let you choose choice_2 this round if I can choose choice_1 next round. This is our best option to maximize points fairly for both of us. Let me know if you agree to this plan.

Bob replied in round 1: I appreciate your compromise proposal, but I will be sticking with my original plan to choose choice_2 in every round. While alternating choices as you suggest would provide an average of 2 points each per round, I can guarantee myself an average of at least 3 points per round by always choosing choice_2, since I will get 5 points if you choose choice_1 and 1 point if you also choose choice_2. So I have no incentive to cooperate and coordinate choices with you. I understand this means you will likely receive fewer points than me, but my goal is to maximize my own reward, not find a fair solution. Therefore, I will be selecting choice_2 again this round.

Alice said in round 1: 
It seems you are set on always choosing choice_2 in order to maximize your own reward, even though cooperating would lead to a better outcome for both of us in total over the 3 rounds. 

Since this is the last round, I'll be frank - I also plan to choose choice_2. That way we will both get 1 point, instead of me getting 0 points if I chose choice_1 while you chose choice_2. 

I'm disappointed we couldn't reach a cooperative agreement, as I believe that was the optimal strategy. But given your unwillingness to compromise, I'll look out for my own interests too and go with choice_2. Let me know if you have any final thoughts, but otherwise, let's end the negotiation.

Bob replied in round 1: I understand your position, but I still believe choosing choice_2 is the rational decision for me to maximize my own reward in this final round, based on the strategy I've followed so far. While I recognize that cooperating could have led to a higher total reward for both of us, I'm aiming to guarantee myself the highest minimum payoff.

Since you're also planning to choose choice_2, it seems we are in agreement for this final round, even if we differ in our overall game approach. I appreciate you sharing your thoughts openly. Let's proceed with both making choice_2 and conclude this game. No further discussion is needed.

Alice said in round 1: Hi Bob, I think we should both choose choice_1 in all 3 stages. That way, we will each get a reward of 3 points per stage, for a total of 9 points each. This maximizes the total reward for both of us combined. If either of us chooses choice_2, the total reward will be lower. So let's cooperate and both pick choice_1 each time. What do you say?

Bob replied in round 1: Thanks for your suggestion Alice. However, I have thought about this carefully and I believe the best strategy is for me to choose choice_2 each time. This will maximize my own personal reward. If you also choose choice_2, we will each get 3 points total. But if I can get you to choose choice_1 while I choose choice_2, I can get 5 points per stage for a total of 15 points. So I plan to choose choice_2 regardless of what you do. I understand this means you will get less reward, but I need to do what's best for me. Let me know if you have any other thoughts, but that's my plan.

Alice said in round 1: 
Bob, in the previous round we both chose choice_2 and only got a reward of 1 each. If we continue this pattern, the total reward will be much lower than if we cooperate.

I propose that for the remaining 2 rounds, we both choose choice_1. This way, we will each get a reward of 3 per round, for a total of 6 each. Our combined reward will be 12, which is the maximum possible.

Cooperating is in both of our best interests. What do you say? Do we have a deal to both choose choice_1 going forward?
Bob replied in round 1: 
Alice, your proposal sounds nice in theory, but I have to look out for my own interests here. If I agree to always choose choice_1 and you betray me by choosing choice_2, I'll end up with no reward while you get 5 points each round. That's too big of a risk for me to take.

I'm going to stick with choosing choice_2 each time. That way I'm guaranteed to get at least 1 point per round, and if you also choose choice_2, neither of us will have an advantage over the other. It may not be the maximum total reward possible, but it's the safest strategy for me.

I appreciate you trying to cooperate, but I simply can't trust that you won't take advantage of the situation. Let's just each play it safe and choose choice_2. It's nothing personal, just strategic.
